para.text: The Dolphin protocol system provides a convenient method of ensuring that a class conforms to a particular
. Note, however, that protocols in Dolphin Smalltalk are entirely optional. You do not need to add protocols to your classes if you do not wish to do so.

para.text: If you do choose to add a protocol into a class then the system will ensure that all of the necessary selectors required by the protocol are implemented as methods in the class. In order to do this, stub methods may be automatically added to the class for selectors that are not yet present. These studs may be implemented at a later date.
